column5: We are heading to Eagle Lake in July and was looking for feedback on Stanley's guided catch and release Musky fly out trip.

My son and I took the option 3 years ago and it was a great experience. Take the fly rod and some surface baits as well as some Mepps spinners and you will have a ball. We had 30 + fish up to 13 pounds. Marv guided us and it was definitely time well spent.
Do they provide any rods or tackle or just transportation?
Your equipment. They fly you in and give you guidance
$400 for a one day trip and no equipment available. Is this standard practice?

5-10 pound fish........a spinning rod with maybe some #5 Mepps spinners would be all you would need. Specialized heavy musky gear would not be fun at all. A fly in, boat and gas for a couple people for $400 bucks doesn't sound bad....try doing it on foot. I'm sure the people at Stanleys could answer these questions for you.
Now that makes sense, thanks for the info.

I have not been on the fly in but have been going to Stanley's for over 30 years. It is a first class operation and if you need a fly rod,besides your normal fishing pole, I bet they can round one up for you. I have talked to many that have really enjoyed the Musky adventure
